intro: Scorzonera turkestanica subsp. turkestanica, commonly known as the Turkestan scorzonera, is a perennial herb native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its robust, hairy stems and large, showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Scorzonera turkestanica subsp. turkestanica is also noted for its edible tuberous roots, which have been used in traditional medicine and cuisine.
